intro: Cupia setigera, commonly known as the slender cupia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, providing a textured appearance. Cupia setigera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
